message: Guys, quick sync lang. Objective natin this week is ma-complete yung Task Management feature ng system para ready na siya for demo. Gusto ng client na simple lang pero very clear kung ano yung status ng bawat task.
Okay, so ang main goal talaga is working end-to-end flow? From create task, edit, mark as done, tapos persistent kahit mag-refresh?
Yes, exactly. Ayaw nila nung parang checklist lang na nawawala. Gusto nila na parang tracker na may history.
So kailangan malinaw sa UI kung alin yung active, alin yung due today, and alin yung done. o Kasi yun yung magiging basis ng daily workflow ng user.
Hello
So kailangan malinaw sa UI kung alin yung active, alin yung due today, and alin yung done. o Kasi yun yung magiging basis ng daily workflow ng user.
Hello
Agree. From user perspective, pag open pa lang ng app, dapat alam agad nila kung ano yung priority nila for today.
Tama. Yan talaga yung objective clarity and focus. Hindi dapat mag-isip pa yung user kung ano ang uunahin.
On the backend sidd, I'l support that by making sure bawat task may status, may date, and hindi siya dini-delete kapag madked as done. Status change lang talaga.
Dominic Almazan
On the backend sidd, I'l support that by making sure bawat task may status, may date, and hindi siya dini-delete kapag madked as done. Status change lang talaga.
Good. Sa frontend, i-group ko yung tasks based sa logic na yan. Today tasks sa taas, o upcoming sa gitna, tapos done sa baba. Para natural yung flow.\
Yes, ganyan mismo yung gusto ng client. Parang daily task assistant, hindi lang listahan.
I'll focus sa layout and labels. Kahit Taglish yung text, dapat intuitive pa rin. Like “Due Today”, “Upcoming”, “Done Tasks".
can help sa validation side. I'll check kung consistent yung behavior, like pag nag-mark ng done, hindi biglang nawawala, and may option to undo.
I'll focus sa layout and labels. Kahit Taglish yung text, dapat “Due Today", “Upcoming”, “Done Tasks".
can help sa validation side. I'll check kung consistent yung behavior, like pag nag-mark ng done, hindi biglang nawawala, and may option to undo.
Nice. Undo is very important. Part yan ng objective natin na maging forgiving yung system sa user.
Question lang, kapag in-undo yung done task, babalik ba siya sa original group niya based on date?
Yes. Kung today yung deadline niya, balik siya sa today. Kung future date, balik siya sa upcoming.
Question lang, kapag in-undo yung done task, babalik ba siya sa original group niya based on date?
Yes. Kung today yung deadline niya, balik siya sa today. Kung future date, balik siya sa upcoming.
Okay, noted. I'll make sure yung state management kaya i-handle yung ganung behavior.
Also, check ko rin yung refresh behavior. Pag nag-refresh yung page, same grouping pa rin o dapat makita ng user.
Correct. Persistence is non-negotiable. Kahit mag-logout or refresh, andun pa rin yung tasks.
So overall, ang objective natin is: when we demo this, masasabi natin na this feature helps  users organize their work daily without losing task history.
Correct. Persistence is non-negotiable. Kahit mag-logout or rin yung tasks.
So overall, ang objective natin is: when we demo this, masasabi natin na this feature helps users organize their work daily without losing task history.
Exactly. That's the story we're building. Basta aligned tayo sa goal na yan, okay na yung execution.
Copy. I'll start with the API structure and let you know once ready for integration.
Perfect. Let's keep the objective in mind habang ginagawa. Update lang kayo if may blockers.
Guys, quick sync lang. Objective natin this week is ma-complete yung Task Management feature ng system para ready na siya for demo. Gusto ng client na simple lang pero very clear
